column1: short of a length on middle stump, quickly onto the back foot to tap this to midwicket
length on leg stump, gets deep in the crease and whips it to deep midwicket
tossed up on middle stump, nicely forward to drive to long-on
there he goes. He's a new man these days, this guy. Jumps down the track and makes room. Doesn't get to the pitch but goes through with the shot and lifts it over the bowler off the inside half
length ball down leg side, looks to sweep and can't connect
lofted over wide mid-off. Tossed up at off stump and once again he makes room to launch one. Cleaner hit this time
length ball on leg stump, punched to long-on off the back foot
length ball on middle stump, tapped wide of mid-on. Leans into this one, head very still
length ball outside off, firmly punched on the up to cover
length ball on middle stump, flicked neatly to deep square's left. Waited a long time before turning the wrists on that
mistimed slap on the up flies off the inside half of the bat and bounces wide of mid-on. Stepped out and wanted to lift this straight over the bowler
top edge as he closes the face early this time. Short of a length ball rises up at his chest and he's not in control of this. Lands short of cover
pushed uppishly into the off side. Tries to lean into a length ball on the up, but this rises and he has to open the face in the end
length ball on leg stump, steps out and clips it to deep square
length ball angled in at leg stump. Climbs up at him as he looks to punch into the leg side and he checks the shot
dances around a bit, makes room and returns, and loses his poise against a full toss on leg stump. Can only manage to tickle it down to fine leg

taken at deep square! Move over Ashes, we have a new contest - Peter Chase has Kohli caught in the deep again. Gets a short ball to climb nicely up at his ribs to curb the full-blooded pull. It's a half-minded loft from under the ball in the end as he steps out. Made him very awkward with that one. The fielder has some distance to cover to his right before waiting a long time. Does so and takes it low to his right.
length ball on leg stump, flicked to deep square
has him hopping first ball. But it's a length ball in the corridor. Taps it into the leg side with soft hands
short of a length at the body, fended into the square leg region
length ball on leg stump, finds short fine leg with the glance
caresses a pull to fine leg's right. On the back foot quickly as this short ball slants across him
watch your beers over there. KL Rahul 2.0 - vicious behind the wicket. Faux-falls into the off side against the short ball to make room above his hips and then whips this over the long leg boundary
short ball angled into the body. Backs away and looks to cut. Under-edge into the pitch
length ball outside off, punched on the up to cover

wow! Gorgeous hit from Raina. Length ball rising up outside off from Thompson, who is bowling around the wicket. Raina stretches his arms out and extends at the point of contact to send it flying over extra cover
short of a length outside off, punched to cover off the back foot
poor bowling from Thompson. An overpitched ball on the pads and Raina leans in and channels 15 years of his life as he slugs this over deep midwicket
yikes. Full toss lands wayyyyy outside the pitch on the off side
better. Lands this one, but it's too wide as well
oh boy. A full ball down leg side this time. Raina goes after it but can't get bat on it
length ball angled in at off stump. Backs away and taps it to mid-off
offcutter floated up at leg stump, pushed to long-on off the front foot
short of a length just outside off, punched off the back foot to mid-off
length ball on leg stump, flicked to deep square
beaten. Nervous poke from Raina. Length ball pushed across the corridor and his boots are colliding with each other as his hands reach out for this
beaten again. Wild slog after stepping out against this short ball. Sails over the stumps
gets it past midwicket off the inside half. An ugly heave after stepping out again, but a pretty result. He was cramped and dragging this on the up
bouncer at middle stump, gets inside the line and dabs it behind fine with a hook

full toss outside off, mistimed punch to mid-off. A quick single attempted and the throw strikes Rahul who hobbles and gets on the floor after making his ground. Looks like he might have taken that one on the knee.
short of a length on middle stump, onto the back foot to whip this to deep midwicket
length ball outside off, leans in and flicks into the open leg side region
short of a length on leg stump, flicked on the up to deep midwicket
full on middle stump, flicks with soft hands to deep square
length ball on middle stump, steps out and taps to long-on
full toss on the pads, punched to deep midwicket
length ball on the pads, whipped to deep square

now you Simi, now you don't. KL Rahul has hit what looks like a 100-metre plus hit and not even the cameraman can track that. Length ball on middle stump and he's down the track to plunder this with a clean swing. Way over long-on.
length ball down leg side, left alone
Simi outside. Length ball on middle stump again. In the crease this time but a massive stride forward for the slog sweep to clear deep midwicket
bisects deep midwicket and long-on. Full toss just outside off and he punches it firmly
short of a length at middle stump, punched to deep midwicket off the back foot
length ball angled in from around the wicket, tapped to deep midwicket with soft hands
fires one in flat at off stump, can't do more than block this on the front foot
yorker wide outside off, reaches out and toe-ends it to sweeper cover
fires another yorker in, but this one's down leg side
yorker outside off, driven to sweeper cover
attempted yorker again. It's a full toss on the pads. Raina swats it away with scarcely any respect, but it lands on the bounce in front of deep backward square
another yorker. Can't get under it. Mistimed slog rolls out to long-on
full toss lifted cleanly over extra cover. Raina waited in the crease this time, didn't get a big stride out. Used the pace
full on the stumps, driven out to long-off
swiped between deep midwicket and long-on. Dockrell drops short and Raina swings cleanly and holds his pose.
full and flat down leg side. Steps out and just manages to get bat to find a single at deep backward square
length on leg stump, leans in and taps to short fine leg
yorker on leg stump, nudged straight to short fine
tossed up on middle stump, flicked to deep midwicket's right to pick up two

just over fine leg! Not very convincing, but enough behind that pull for Rahul to get to his fifty. Short on middle, and Rahul swivels and then thumps it behind square. Fine leg did stick his hand out, and the ball almost stuck in his palm
length ball on middle again, and Rahul mistimes his back-foot pull on this occasion. The ball trickles away to square leg
full outside off, and angling further away from Raina. He sticks his bat out, and opens it's face, and then runs the delivery down to third man

rolls his fingers over this one, but Rahul spots that early. Half-tracker outside off and Rahul creams it over cover. What bat speed! We need the third umpire for this one, and hey, it's over the boundary

length ball on middle, but going down leg. Another extra added to India's total. Rahul had already shuffled across to the offside after spotting that length, and therefore missed the nudge to fine leg
slower ball outside off, and Rahul taps it off the front foot to cover point. Calls early for the quick single
full on off, and Raina tries to drive it straight. The ball stays low, and takes the under-edge off the bat. Dribbles into the keeper's gloves
in the slot, and punished! Full just outside off, and that's in Rahul's arc. Gets his front foot out of the way, and thumps it over the bowler's head. Straight into the sightscreen
flatter ball on middle. It turns into Rahul's pads, so he goes onto the back foot. Punches to the vacant midwicket region for a single
short and wide outside off. No real spin for the bowler, so Raina rocks back and cuts to the sweeper fielder in the deep
flat again on off. Rahul stays on the back foot and pushes to long on for a walking single. Quicker ball too
full toss on middle, and that's been whipped off his hips to deep backward square leg. Dockrell will feel lucky that hasn't found the boundary. Raina finds the fielder in the deep

full toss but wide outside off. Rahul looks to free his arms, so attempts a heave over cover. The ball takes the inside edge and flies away to short fine leg instead. Twenty-two deliveries without a dot for Rahul

gone first ball! Spongy bounce, and Rahul taps it straight back to the bowler. Length ball on off that Rahul tried to punch. The ball held up on the surface, and Rahul's through his shot too early. Hits his bat near the sticker area, and O'Brien pounces onto it like a hungry cat
rolls his fingers over this one. Two dots in a row for KOB. Back of a length on middle, and tapped off the back foot

full outside off, and Rohit tries to play the square drive. He wedges it away behind square, but the ball goes straight to backward point! He's disappointed as the bowler goes on to do a jig. Rohit makes 97 one day, falls for a duck two days later. Welcome to the uncertain world of cricket
full outside off, and Pandey carefully drives at this one. Played away from his body, but played with soft hands. Back to the bowler
length ball just outside off, and Pandey must back away before punching through the covers. Man in the deep cleans up
length ball outside leg stump, and Wilson collects the ball in a flash. Considers whipping the bails off for a prospective stumping, but Raina's back leg was always inside the crease
length ball on leg, and Raina pulls off the back foot. Played along the ground to the sweeper fielder on the leg side
back of a length outside off, and Raina pokes at it. Played to short third man as they scamper across for one
full on middle, and Pandey shuffles onto the back foot. Defends it
full on off, and Pandey check-drives to short cover. The fielder dives forward, stops, and then the bowler cleans up
length ball outside off, and Pandey makes some room before cutting it square. Goes to the fielder in the deep
Raina uses his feet, and so Dockrell goes short. Pitches it wide, and therefore Raina must adjust his shot. Checks, and then pushes to cover
time for Pandey to free his arms, but he finds the fielder at long on. It was full on off, and Pandey freed his arms to try and play it over the top. Mistimed straight however
full on middle, and Pandey tees up this time. Swings with all his power to the leg side, but the fielder at cow corner is alert

back of a length on off, and Raina drags a pull shot straight back to KOB. The bowler sticks his hand out, and the ball hits his palm. Almost ricochets onto the non-striker's stumps with Pandey trying to scamper his way back
driven to cover off the front foot
full on leg stump, and all Pandey can do is tap it to the vacant midwicket region. He wants the second, but Raina says there's no scope for the double

full and wide outside off. Raina reaches far at it, trying to drive to cover, but he misses, and then the keeper whips the bails off. Definitely wide, but is Raina stumped? Doesn't look like, because Raina's back leg is just behind the line. He's fine
yorker on middle, and that delivery doesn't deserve to go for a boundary. But the flick - nudged past short fine leg - gets Raina his fifty T20I half-century!.
full on middle, and Raina slogs towards the leg side. No real foot movement, and he mistimes it to long on for one. Keeps strike though
back of a length on middle, but it's the cutter from the bowler. Loopy bounce, and Raina can't pick the length. Misses the pull, and the ball goes to Gary Wilson on the bounce

length ball on middle, and that's been shoveled over the fielder at wide long on! Six number nine for India, and what a way to get to 150. Raina judged the length, stood tall, and then thumped it towards the leg side
full on leg, and that's been flicked to fine leg. Raina's slightly overbalanced, but he still manages to use his wrists to play it fine behind square
full on leg stump, but Pandey was expecting that. He went way into the leg side, and then mistimed a slog to long on. They walk across for one

waist-high full toss on middle, and Raina comfortably whips it off his hips to the leg side. Looks like cow corner - Dockrell - attempted to go for the catch, but the ball lands short, and then bounces into the boundary rope
full toss on middle again, and Raina muscles it to the sweeper fielder on the leg side. Keeps strike
full, and too wide outside off. He's got to bowl that again

overcompensates this time, so it's a full toss outside off. He drills the drive to wide long off, and the fielder relays it back to deep cover. But deep cover wasn't prepared for that lob, and that allows India an extra run
flat on middle, and pulled along the ground to Thompson at cow corner
full on middle, and Pandey opens his stance. Smacks it to the sweeper fielder on the leg side
low full toss on off, and Raina goes down on one knee. Slog sweeps hard, but finds the fielder manning the leg-side boundary
full toss, but wide outside off. Pandey winds up, and then drills this straight past the bowler's right, but long-off is protected
full, and very wide outside off. Raina reaches at it, and therefore has no power in his cover drive
overpitched on off, and Raina drives it straight past the non-striker to long off
good length outside off, and he tries to flat-bat it straight to long on. Mistimes the shot
it's an offcutter that lands short on middle, and Raina can't resist himself. Pulls off the back foot, and straight to Dockrell at cow corner. KOB gets his third!
full outside off, and Pandey backs away. With the extra space in hand, he drives inside out past the cover fielder. First boundary for Pandey
back of a length outside off, and Pandey slices a cut past backward point. Stirling - in the deep - does well to intercept
good length outside off, and Pandya plays a confident cover drive. Straight to the fielder

yorker on leg stump, and Pandey attempts to squeeze it towards the leg side. But he jams into that shot, and the bat's bottom half has come off! How hard did he hit into the pitch?! We need repairwork
full just outside off, and Hardik thumps it past the non-striker. Hit hard, but finds long on
length ball on off, and Pandey mistimes a pull to cow corner
wild! Length ball on middle, and angling down leg. Easy decision for the umpire
full on off, and angling into Pandya's pads. Whips it off his legs, and the ball soars into the deep backward square stand. As easy as ABC

in the slot, and that's been hammered! Full on off, and all Pandya has to do is: get the front foot out of the way, swing hard, and then bring out the full follow through of the bat. Lands beyond cow corner
full on leg again, and Pandya tries to play the helicopter slog. Comes off the bat's inside edge and goes to short midwicket instead. No one's there, so the bowler must give it a chase
full, but wide outside off. Pandey doesn't offer a shot
full outside off again, and Pandey drills this drive through the covers. Man stationed in the deep though, but still these two have enough time to turn back for the second
full outside off, and Pandey gets down on one knee to slog towards the leg side. But the shot comes off the bat's inside edge
is that wicket number four for Kevin O' Brien? Oh hell no! Full outside off, and Pandya's forced to reach at it. Slices this slog over long off, and Porterfield is a mere spectator in the deep
into orbit! Full just outside off, and you know Hardik loves that length. Opens his stance, and then drills it over KOB's head. Delightful
short outside off, and Pandya flat-bats it past the bowler. Mid on does well to make a lot of ground, but his diving stop just isn't good enough. Four more for Pandya
ends with just a single. Full outside off, and mistimed to long off. India finish on 213 for 4
length ball outside off, and jagging away from Stirling. He mistimes a cut to point

taken at first slip! Just a bit of shape away from the right-hander, and Stirling can't resist the width. Tries to punch it towards cover but he's nowhere near the pitch of the ball. Takes the outside edge, and easily pocketed by the team's safest fielder
full outside off, and he leans into that drive. Smashes it, but straight to cover point. The fielder has a shy at the non-striker's stumps. But misses
length ball on off, and zipping into the left-hander's pads. Tries to defend, but takes the inside edge onto his pads
overpitched just outside off, and Porterfield manages to wedge this away to cover point
good length on leg, and Porterfield slogs towards the leg side. It's in control as the ball runs away to the fine-leg fielder
length ball on off, and the batsman tried to drag a shot to the leg side. Misses the hoick, and the ball hits the back of his bat! Goes straight back to Kaul
length ball outside off, but angling further away. The batsman tries to lean into the cover drive, but he's through his shot too early
back of a length on middle, and he manages to connect with the leg-side slog. Intercepted by midwicket though
length ball on middle, and he goes across the line trying to hit it towards leg side. Misses, and the ball hits his front leg. Nobody appeals though, because the impact was too high
full just outside off, and Shannon drives away from his body. Timed well, but straight to cover
full on off, and that's been picked up so well! Short-arm jab to deep backward square, but Rohit Sharma does an excellent job getting around that shot. Only two for that exquisite a shot
fine! No stopping that. Short outside leg, and Porterfield gloves this ball, fine down the leg side. That's not where he expected the pull shot to go, but Ireland will take it
length ball outside off, and he cuts this brilliantly off the back foot. Straight to Rahul at short point, but he manages to get fingertips to it. Slows the shot down

that's a biggie! Picks the slower ball early, and slog-sweeps it over deep midwicket. Slow, loopy and full on off stump. Just wide enough from the batsman for him to really free his arms. The Irish are enjoying this

And friends, that's how you come back! Full. Straight. On middle. Porterfield tries being cheeky - attempting the leg-side ramp - but Umesh's fiery pace has him beaten all ends up. The ball darts straight into the base of middle and the experienced Porterfield must walk back
full on leg stump, and that's been nudged fine down the leg side
full just outside off, and that's a classic cover drive from Balbirnie. Stands tall, and drives through the covers. The infielders stand still
stays low! Length ball just outside off, and he tries to work it towards the leg side. Deceived by the lack of pace and bounce
another change up from Kaul. Length ball outside off, and jagging away after pitching. The batsman ran down the wicket but missed the slap towards the off side
back of a length on middle. Cramped for space, and mistimes his pull. Straight to square leg

short outside off, and too close to his body for the pull. Beaten by pace and all he can do is slice it to the off side. In the air for a short while, and loops straight into short cover's hands. Kaul's first wicket for India, or is it? Looks like he's overstepped. The umpire's taking his time. Aaaand, it's official. Say hello to your first wicket, Sid Kaul
short on middle, and loops over the batsman's head. Too high, says the umpire
knuckle ball, short outside off. Slapped to cover point
length ball angling into middle stump. Balbirnie tucks it to midwicket for a quick single
oh, so close! Just past the bat's outside edge. Length ball outside off and he tries to glance it fine to third man. Misses, and goes through to DK
full outside off, and he tries to drive inside out. Through his shot too early, and the ball goes to the leg side instead
full on off, and that's been driven with the straight bat to mid on
full just outside off, and check-driven off the front foot. Hit rather uppishly, but the chip lands short of Chahal at wide mid off
length ball outside off, and he stands tall to run it fine to third man. Shall keep strike
good length on middle, and sliding through. Wilson's quick to get onto the back foot and tap it back
full on off, and he sweeps it hard down on one knee. Straight to the fielder in the deep
length ball on leg stump, and he punches to cover point. Off the bat's top half
short and wide, cut straight to point
full on leg, and he slog sweeps to midwicket. Pandey scampers to his right, and his dive stops a certain boundary

full on leg, and spinning away from Balbirnie. Gets some turn with his over's final ball, and the delivery crashes into middle stump. Balbirnie defends down the wrong line and Yuzi gets to celebrate. End of the Powerplay as well
digs the bouncer in too short. It climbs past the batsman's shoulder down leg side
shot. But there's a fielder at deep point. Short and wide from Pandya and it's sweetly chopped
length ball on middle, defended into the leg side off the back foot

aaaaaand celebrations. Kevin O'Brien has looked to clobber this wide on the right side of TV screens all over the world, but it's ended up left, in the hands of third man who had 15 yards to run. A length ball holding its line outside off and he's got a big leading edge
bumps third man and deflects into the boundary. Kuldeep, who just took that catch last ball, has come down slowly with the barrier as Wilson chops one to him off the back foot
beaten. Pandya slants one in beautifully into the corridor and gets it to climb and leave the batsman who hangs his bat out at it
length ball outside off, drives on the up and nearly into short cover-point's hands. Lands just in front of that fielder
big appeal from DK, albeit a belated one. Chahal seems to have beaten Simi on the forward defence but the keeper has heard something.The umpire hasn't

they Simi rollin'. Ireland are six down. Singh has walked into the off side to try and get behind the line for his premeditated sweep. He has missed the legbreak, pitching on middle, striking him in front of off. Lbw says the umpire. He isn't happy
length ball on leg stump, flicked to deep square
full outside off, swept to deep square leg
length on middle stump, goes forward and gets it into the leg side off the inside edge
short and wide outside off, cut to sweeper cover
shot. Lovely from Wilson. This is tossed up on off stump. He gets down and confidently slots this reverse sweep into the third man boundary
length on off stump, blocked on the front foot

bowled him. Wilson, composed for all of two balls, has lost his shape against this. Massive gap between bat and front foot as he looks to drive on the up. Looks like he was playing for the wrong'un. It's spun back in and tonked leg stump as he slips backwards
wrong'un, tossed up at leg stump on a length. Blocked on the front foot
length ball floated up at off stump, blocked on the front foot
short of a length and spinning in sharply at the stumps. Looks to punch through cover off the back foot, gets it into the leg side off the inside half
full and flat at the stumps. Flicks it straight to mid-on
tossed up generously outside off. Looks to sweep. Mistimes it
slider, back of a length at middle stump. Defended off the back foot
top edge over slip as he looks to sweep another on from outside off. Pulled back by short third man
length ball pushed flat at off stump and Thompson does superbly to get down on a knee and watch this one on, before paddling it fine
top edge. This time over the newly-stationed leg slip. It's a googly that hasn't been picked. No one stopping this one from hitting the boundary padding though

holes out. Dockrell's eyes light up as Kuldeep puts one up in his swinging arc. Swing, he does, but even with his big reach, he hasn't made the pitch of the ball. Enough spin for the bat to turn in his hands
short of a length outside off, punched to sweeper cover
short outside off, pushed to mid-off off the back foot
length ball on middle, picked up against the turn with a slog. On the bounce to deep midwicket's left
short outside off, cut to sweeper cover

oh boy, Rankin! What a shot that is! Loopy length ball lands outside off to discover that a giant is running at it. Tries to turn away, but it's too late. The bat has come a full clean swing from underneath to launch this high over long-off
short of a length slider outside off, beaten as he looks to cut
length ball spinning in at leg stump from around the wicket. Flicked to deep midwicket
short and wide and spinning back in. Past the outside edge on the cut shot
length ball wide outside off. Left alone
length on middle stump, flicked to deep midwicket from deep in the crease
got him. Steps out and is beaten in flight. He's made too much room to try and drive this and as a result, can't get close to the pitch of the ball. It spins back in sharply and takes leg stump
length ball outside off, beats the outside edge as he looks to defend
good length on middle stump, defended off the back foot
got some bat on this one. Short and wide outside off. Duly slapped away to long-off's right off the back foot

sharp stumping. Dinesh Karthik picks the wrong'un and gathers down leg side. Rankin doesn't as he steps out to be beaten on the inside edge. No chance of returning as the keeper completes the job. And the match.
